intro: Impatiens arunensis, commonly known as the Arun Valley impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
